designScenario.name: Aileron System
designScenario.description: The Aileron System is a critical flight control subsystem responsible for managing the aircraft's roll dynamics by asymmetrically deflecting wing-mounted ailerons. It converts electrical commands from the Actuator Control Module into precise mechanical movements, enabling controlled banking and stabilization during flight. The system integrates high-strength composite materials, redundant actuation mechanisms, and real-time feedback sensors to ensure reliability under extreme aerodynamic loads, temperature variations, and operational stress. Design priorities include minimal latency, fail-safe redundancy, corrosion resistance, and compatibility with adaptive flight control algorithms.

details.description: Convert electrical command signals into differential aileron deflections to induce controlled roll moments.
Maintain synchronization between left and right aileron surfaces to prevent unintended yaw effects.
Achieve full deflection range (±25°) within 50 milliseconds of command input.
Maintain angular positioning accuracy of ±0.1° under dynamic load fluctuations.
Incorporate dual-channel hydraulic/electric actuators with automatic cross-over upon primary system failure.
Deploy mechanical load-limiting devices to prevent over-torque damage during extreme deflection scenarios.
Utilize corrosion-resistant aluminum alloys and composite skins with operational capability between -55°C and +70°C.
Implement modular hinge and actuator designs for field-replaceable components without full wing disassembly.

systemComponents.name: Control Surface Assembly
systemComponents.description: Primary aerodynamic structure comprising the aileron's movable surface, hinge mechanisms, and load-bearing spar connections.

subComponents.name: Aileron Skin
subComponents.description: Aerodynamically shaped outer surface constructed from carbon-fiber-reinforced polymer (CFRP) for stiffness and fatigue resistance.

subComponents.name: Torque Tube
subComponents.description: Central structural member transmitting actuator forces to the aileron surface via integrated hinge points.

systemComponents.name: Actuation Mechanism
systemComponents.description: Dual-redundant electromechanical or hydraulic actuators converting control signals into linear/rotary motion.

subComponents.name: Servo Actuator
subComponents.description: Primary force-generating unit with integrated servo valve and position feedback transducer.

subComponents.name: Ball Screw Drive
subComponents.description: Mechanical linkage converting rotary actuator motion into linear deflection of the aileron control horn.

systemComponents.name: Feedback Sensors
systemComponents.description: Sensor suite monitoring real-time aileron position, hinge moments, and actuator health parameters.

subComponents.name: LVDT Position Sensor
subComponents.description: Linear variable differential transformer providing high-resolution deflection angle measurements.

subComponents.name: Strain Gauge Array
subComponents.description: Distributed sensors quantifying bending and torsional loads on the aileron structure.

systemComponents.name: Redundancy Module
systemComponents.description: Fail-operational control unit managing actuator cross-over and load redistribution during system faults.

subComponents.name: Cross-Channel Comparator
subComponents.description: Real-time monitoring of actuator outputs for discrepancy detection and automatic reconfiguration.

subComponents.name: Backup Power Relay
subComponents.description: Isolated electrical supply ensuring actuator operation during primary power bus failures.

relationships.description: The Aileron System is aggregated within the broader Flight Surfaces assembly, contributing specialized roll control functionality.
Aileron deflection commands originate from the Actuator Control Module's flight control computers via ARINC 429 data buses.
The Actuation Mechanism is physically integrated with the Control Surface Assembly through load-path-critical mechanical linkages.
Sensor outputs are continuously analyzed by the Redundancy Module to validate system integrity and initiate failover procedures.

attributes.name: maxDeflectionAngle
attributes.description: Maximum allowable mechanical deflection in both upward and downward directions from neutral position.

attributes.name: hingeMomentCapacity
attributes.description: Peak torque resistance at hinge points during maximum dynamic pressure (Q) conditions.

attributes.name: actuatorForceOutput
attributes.description: Hydraulic actuator force generation capability under normal operating pressure.

attributes.name: harmonicResponse
attributes.description: Minimum natural frequency of the aileron assembly to prevent flutter-induced oscillations.

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Design Assurance Level (DAL) certifying compliance with catastrophic failure probability requirements (<1E-9 per flight hour).

attributes.name: surfaceRigidity
attributes.description: Maximum torsional deformation allowance under limit aerodynamic loads.

comments.body: Implements dual dissimilar actuators with mechanical summation for failure conditions per FAR 25.671
